intro: Kohautia lasiocarpa var. thymifolia, commonly known as the thyme-leaved kohautia, is a perennial plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
